alert.note: Alert for Eastern Curry County and Josephine County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued November 06 at 1:32AM PST until November 06 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE FLAT AND SMITH RIVER COMPLEX BURN SCARS REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Periods of moderate to heavy rainfall are expected overnight into Monday morning. There is a low probability that this heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding and/or debris flows on the Flat burn scar and the Oregon side of the Smith River Complex burn scar. * WHERE...The Flat burn scar in eastern Curry County and the Smith River Complex burn scar in far southwestern Josephine County and far southeastern Curry County. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Moderate to heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. The heaviest rainfall is most likely in thunderstorms during the overnight and early morning hours. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Total rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2.5 inches of is expected over an 18 hour period across the Flat and Smith River Complex burn scars. Higher rainfall rates in thunderstorms, which could approach 1 inch per hour, will increase the threat. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Curry County and Josephine County
